column4: you have to configure it, there is a howto in the src directory for the kernel

what setting are you trying to enable?
CONFIG_NETDEVICES_MULTIQUEUE & CONFIG_NET_SCHED
You still there?
yes was looking in the kernel config
Did you find anything?
conf_net_sched is already built in as a module
Does that mean it is already enabled?
in the stock 9.10 (2.6.31-16-generic) kernel
means its already a module and should load when needed, but you can manually load it yourself from a shell
I am using hardy heron.
should be in there too... check in /boot/ for a file named config with the kernel version, and grep it for the option

np

Sorry had dumb ass moment!
there is no file named config-x.x.x-x-xxx?
Sorry had dumb ass moment!
How can I grep that config file?
How can I grep that /boot/config-2.6.24-26 ?
use 'less /boot/config-2.6.24-26' and in less '/findMe' will search for text
You are a star! Its enabled. Thanks. Long live Ubuntu!!!
